results.title: Randolph Stow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed on location in the landscapes of Suffolk and East Angliam, his present home, Randolf Stow talks of his life and shares examples of his poetry and prose.

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.

results.title: Les Murray
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed at his home, a poetry reading and on his family’s farm in Northern NSW, Les Murray shares his love for poetry in this colourful and engaging portrait.

results.title: Winners Series
results.brief_description: ‘Winners’ and ‘More Winners’ are anthology series of fourteen telemovies, featuring historical drama, comedy, science fiction, fantasy, adventure and social realism. Each film celebrates individuality and the facing of difficult situations with courage and ingenuity.

results.title: Winners : Top Kid (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Gary is a ten year old whizz kid from a lower class family who becomes a famous radio quiz kid and star. He is accepted by his classmates at last. Problems occur when the quiz show starts to rig the answers. Gary is left with a difficult decision between honesty and fame. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners : The Paper Boy (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
During the Depression, Joe’s father gets the sack. The only money the family has is what 13 year old Joe earns from selling papers. Then Joe has a fight with his father and leaves home. He lives on the streets battling with his wits and his fists as he gets to know the characters of the city - the down and outs, the Communist agitators, the Sallies, and Old Harry.
results.description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.

results.title: Winners : The Other Facts of Life (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Ben can’t understand how people can live so happily with the injustice and disaster going on in the world. His family’s lack of response leads Ben to mount a one person awareness crusade. Nothing seems to distract Ben from the larger troubles of the world until a crisis causes him to focus his energies on loving and helping his family.

results.title: Winners : Tarflowers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Garbage is magic, and so is Kev’s job. It’s an important job, and if he and Big Dog didn’t do it, who would? Mrs. Pearl catches stray people like the dog-catcher catches dogs, and every garbage night she and Bruiser hunt Kev through the streets of Newton.

results.title: Winners : Tarflowers (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Kev, and his dog, have a special job - to tend the Tarflowers. But his task is made difficult by Mrs. Pearl and her henchmen who catch stray people. However, Kev’s friend Mary, his mother and the garbage collectors know that the Tarflowers are really magic and that Kev isn’t as dumb as Mrs. Pearl thinks. Part of the “Winners” series.

results.title: Winners : Room to Move (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
Carol is a dedicated runner, coached by her father, day and night. Then she makes friends with Angie, the new girl at school whose punk looks haven’t made her very popular. Angie introduces Carol to the wonderful world of dance. But Carol’s father won’t let her do anything that conflicts with her track-training. Parental pressure is tough on Carol who wants to succeed, but at several things. She rebels and plans a new life for herself. But the all-important race is coming up and Carol has to give it all she’s got. Part of the “Winners” series.

Episode of Series ‘Winners’.
